Node.definition: = title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: length of days; hence: = an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

literally: to add (an activity to someone else's activities); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities add additional activities to those that other humans or deities are currently engaged in

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= causative action by which humans attach objects to other objects with a rope
= the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= small, flat tablet, ◄ made of stone, ► on which words were scratched with a stylus; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to find favor; hence: = state in which humans find the approval of deities or (other) humans
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to know (God); hence: = action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to make someone else's way straight; = causative action by which deities cause the actions and endeavors of humans to be prosperous and successful
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= state in which a person has been restored to health and well being after a time of disease or suffering
literally: navel; hence: = the entire human body
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= construction ► used for storage of harvested crops
= state in which there is an abundance of a certain commodity

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness
= large container; ◄ normally hewn out of stone and part of a winepress; ► where the grape juice is collected
= process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

Node.gloss: to abhor|to detest|to resent|to reject|to oppose|to be hostile
Node.definition: = process by which humans and deities experience an emotion of strong disapproval and rejection of a person or situation
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= to attain a particular state or position
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth and quality
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
literally: length of days; hence: = an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which conditions and circumstances have qualities that inspire appreciation
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
= to communicate to someone else that you consider him/her or someone else fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to found; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities bring something into existence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs
= process by which natural forces find their way by breaking through any obstacles that keep them from moving forward
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans persist in a certain activity
= human power or ability to devise a plan or strategy to accomplish a certain goal

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= the part of the body connecting the head and the rump and containing the passage ways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it
= state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others
= the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

Node.gloss: to hurt one's foot (on something) > to hurt oneself|to stumble
Node.definition: = process by which a human's foot or both feet come in forcible contact with a stone or other object while travelling, ► which may result in stumbling and injury; ≈ usually used in a figurative way to denote sustaining any kind of hardship in life
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: to be pleasing|to be pleasant|to be sweet
Node.definition: = state in which an action brings about a positive and desireable feeling or reaction
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state where humans feel confident◄ due to their reliance on God or something else for protection

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= process by which part of someone's body is caught in a trap, which means that that entire person is under someone else's control
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
literally: power of (one's) hand; hence: = the capacity to perform a certain event
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= a reference to the day after the current day
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which someone exercises his mind (לֵב) in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose; ≈ mostly associated with evil purposes
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= intimate, close association with another person or deity or a group

= act by which humans consign other humans or objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
to treat someone or something with insolence and contempt

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior
= state in which humans have a positive and compassionate attitude towards other humans
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= process by which humans attain an enduring condition or status, ◄ as if it were a permanent gift

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
literally: to lift up; hence: = process by which humans undergo a certain event
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
